hypothesis: maintenance.py proxy-K drift uses stale clean baseline (S188, 164 sessions old) as floor, causing false URGENT signals when actual drift is healthy

method.description: Traced maintenance.py check_proxy_k_drift() floor selection algorithm

control_theory_analysis.failure_mode: Observer staleness — primary measurement channel (clean snapshots) blocked for 164 sessions
control_theory_analysis.analogy: Kalman filter with zero measurement updates — state estimate diverges from reality

iso_mapping.ISO-13: Anti-windup — stale observer caused 4 sessions of unnecessary corrective action (compaction planning that was never needed)
iso_mapping.ISO-1: Optimization under constraint — the threshold sweep (F-CTL1 prior work) was optimizing the wrong parameter; baseline staleness, not threshold values, was the binding constraint

fix_applied.type: Dual observer — fallback to dirty post-compaction baselines when clean floor >50 sessions stale

expect: F-CTL1 advanced: stale-baseline is a more fundamental threshold issue than due/urgent values
actual: CONFIRMED — the F-CTL1 sweep was optimizing due=0.06/urgent=0.10 values, but the real problem was the floor being 164 sessions stale. Fixing the observer (dual baseline) eliminates the false positive entirely without changing any threshold values
diff: F-CTL1 prior work focused on threshold VALUES; actual binding constraint was baseline STALENESS. This reframes F-CTL1 from 'what thresholds?' to 'is the observer healthy?'
